definition: to control/to accuse/to charge/to sue/to invert a container to empty it/(suffix) (slang) buff/enthusiast/devotee/-phile or -philia
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Feedback is the basic concept of cybernetic systems.
sentences.chinese: 反饋是控制論系統的基本概念。

sentences.english: Therefore, very little cybernetic theory ever made it to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 因此，控制論理論幾乎很少對此進行實驗。

sentences.english: Cybernetics was a victim of batch -mode computing.
sentences.chinese: 控制論是批處理計算模式的受害者。

sentences.english: The application of large system cybernetics to bar or wire rolling plants is narrated.
sentences.chinese: 論述了大系統控制論在棒線材廠的應用。

sentences.english: I don't believe a single formal textbook on cybernetics was ever written in English.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲沒有一本正式的控制論教科書是用英文寫成的。

sentences.english: For all its great ideas, cybernetics was mostly talk.
sentences.chinese: 信息傳遞是控制論的最主要的妙策。
控制論究竟發生了什麼事？

sentences.english: Cybernetics was strangled by "putting the observer inside the box."
sentences.chinese: “把觀察者放進盒子裏”這句話扼殺了控制論。
